title: Medical Malpractice Modifications
general_provisions: This bill addresses malpractice actions against health care providers.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>with respect to a medical malpractice action:<hr><ltbullet1>removes the requirement that a claimant submit an affidavit of merit;<hr><ltbullet1>establishes data collection and reporting requirements for the Department of Occupational Licensing and the Administrative Office of the Courts;<hr><ltbullet1>addresses the calculation of noneconomic losses;<hr><ltbullet1>limits, subject to state constitutional protection, the combined amount to which a claimant is potentially entitled for economic and noneconomic losses;<hr><ltbullet1>obligates a plaintiff, in certain circumstances, to pay the reasonable attorney fees and costs incurred by a defendant;<hr><ltbullet1>precludes liability from attaching, in certain circumstances, to a medical facility, clinic, or organization;<hr><ltbullet1>amends the required mental state a health care provider must have, in order to subject the health care provider to punitive damages; and<hr><ltbullet1>amends the process for prelitigation review panels and prelitigation panel reviews; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical changes.
